DOCNAME: CASE OF TNS S.R.O. v. SLOVAKIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time)
TEXT: CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company sued a different company for a sum of money before ORG . In DATE the applicant company paid the court fee . In DATE it modified its claim .

CARDINAL . ORG held the first hearing on DATE . On DATE the defendant company submitted its observations . On DATE , DATE and DATE the case was adjourned at the request of the defendant ’s representative .
CARDINAL . The second hearing was held on DATE . In DATE and DATE the applicant company asked for the proceedings to be accelerated .

CARDINAL . On DATE the case was assigned to a different judge . A hearing which was scheduled for CARDINAL DATE was adjourned at the request of the defendant ’s representative . Another hearing was scheduled for DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant company ’s request about the duration of the proceedings . It held that , despite a shorter period of inactivity , there had been no significant delays in the proceedings in breach of LAW and its constitutional equivalent . The decision stated that the applicant company had modified its action , that it had submitted documentary evidence in the course of the proceedings , and that it had also limited the court in scheduling of hearings .
CARDINAL . Further hearings before ORG were held on DATE and CARDINAL DATE . On DATE it delivered a judgment against which the defendant appealed on DATE .
CARDINAL . The file was submitted to the ORG on DATE . On DATE the court of appeal quashed the first - instance judgment . The decision was served on parties on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked for the case to be proceeded with . Hearings before ORG were scheduled for DATE and DATE . They were adjourned at the request of the defendant ’s representative .

CARDINAL . ORG heard the parties on DATE . Subsequently the parties submitted documentary evidence . Another hearing was held on DATE . In DATE and DATE the parties submitted further observations and evidence . ORG scheduled a hearing for DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Government informed the ORG that the proceedings were pending .
